website_summaries.verdict: The Asics GT 1000 3 is a road shoe designed for neutral runners. Bouncy underfoot cushioning, stability and secure coverage make the Asics GT 1000 3 agreeable to runners who want to get a comfortable running experience on the roads. It is an affordable running companion that is great for all types of activities.
pros: Durable mesh makes the upper unit of the Asics GT 1000 3 formidable and long-lasting
Synthetic overlays are stitched onto the fabric, and they’re meant to keep the foot well-secured
Many runners appreciated the mid-foot stability mechanism in the shoe, which helped them balance their running stance
Lightweight but durable, the SpEVA® Midsole makes sure to deliver more cushioning than the industry standard foam units
Protection from impact is afforded by the Gel® Cushioning System in the heel and forefoot sections
This running shoe doesn’t have an expensive price
cons: The Asics GT 1000 3 ran a bit small for some runners
A few felt that the platform was a bit stiff

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Four Years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes four years ago, and I'm only just now about to retire them. I've been running in Asics for over 10 years and nothing comes close for everyday training shoes. They are a bit old school in their construction (no space age materials or bendy soles) but they are the best for logging miles because they are a quality design that actually works. These shoes are a good balance of lightness and durability and they've done well on road and trail.
customer_reviews.author: Evan C

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but darker than listed picture
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Asics, especially since I have a wide foot and love to run... or atleast try to run. They are a very comfortable shoe and have seem to hold up well, even with regular use. After about a year after purchase, I am just now starting to notice some loss in tread when running around slick sidewalks that have dirt or water on them. I got the silver and blue version and my only disappointment was that they do appear to be darker in real life than in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfortable Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a little wider foot and have used ASICS running shoes since the days I ran long distances. Now I am older but still do a lot of walking and the shoes continue to be very comfortable. A few months ago, I had a knee replacement and decided to replace my old ASICS with new ones. Once again, I was very happy with the fit and comfort of the shoe, definitely my most comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rick von Heydenreich

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - stop changing them, though.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. A couple of years back, I switched from Nike Air Pegasus to Asics GT-1000's. I immediately took to the shoe! Great fit and comfortable on my runs. But, as is the case with most shoes, if it works, then the company will make changes. So, here we are on the 3rd iteration of the shoe. There are some things about the shoe that are great such as cushioning and support. As many others have pointed out, though, the upper mesh, just above the big toe, is designed so that in time, it might tear because of constant contact with the toe. Fortunately for me, that has not happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for the GT-2170, good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace GT-2170's that I'd been using for a few years. These seem just like the GT-2170s. I'm over weight and I over pronate so the right shoe is important to me. These have the right amount of cushion for me and help to correct the overpronation. These shoes are well ventilated and generally hold to my foot without creating any pressure points or uncomfortable rubbing. I'll definitely buy another pair once these are worn out. They are a little on the tight side for the size, so I recommend going half to a full size above your norm.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: uneven left sole
customer_reviews.text: I've just received this pair for the second time. I returned the first pair because, as a previous reviewer stated, there is an uneven decline in the outer side of the left shoe making your ankle role out. Thought I was either crazy or just got a bad pair, but the second pair has the exact same problem on the left shoe. Feels great otherwise. Didn't even wear either pair for 3 minutes. Gonna have to return this one too. Not sure if its asics shoes or amazon selling defective shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Miki

customer_reviews.title: Gel Midsole Cushions the Bottom of Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They're made for running but I love them for every day casual use. The size, width, and gel midsole all sealed the deal. Without a gel midsole I would experience pain on the bottom of my feet as I pound the pavement when out walking for exercise. The mesh upper, the light weight, and black color are pluses. I replaced the removable inner soles to accommodate custom-made arch supports and they all work fine. I've bought these shoes before and will probably buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schlechter

customer_reviews.title: Actual running review. Good mild stability on any surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for street running but have ended up running on dirt roads and trails with them as well. They do provide stability without the lop-sided feeling of high stability shoes. This is my first pair of Asics. It is a high quality shoe at a bargain price because it is not the latest style and is all man-made material. They work for me both for short three-mile runs on a track or a street, or longer 10k and 8-mile runs on mixed surfaces. I've used New Balance in the recent past but whenever I find one I like they discontinue it.
customer_reviews.author: R. DevinneyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a first rate training shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Asics GT-1000 is my shoe of choice for training runs. It combines ample cushioning with solid stability. Although it does not have the latest technology, it. Incorporates excellent proven features. This is my fourth pair of GT-1000s and my previous pairs gave over 500 miles of service with only limited wear on the rubber outsole. This shoe is great for running on paved roads since the cushioning protects ankle and knee joints from injury and the soles offer more than adequate traction even on wet pavement. The shoe is also excellent for running on most dry trails although I go with trail shoes with more traction when running on muddy or really rough trails.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe... but don't buy these thinking they have a Gore-tex liner
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new pair of water proof/resistant runners every fall for the long wet winter of running. I love Asics because of their wide widths and mistakenly was fooled into buying these because Amazon has them listed as having a Gore-tex upper. There is no Gore-tex in these at all. Otherwise they are a great shoe for us wide feet folks. I did submit a correction request to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe except that the breathable mesh tears somewhat easily
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe except that the breathable mesh tears somewhat easily. I used the shoe for work (Valet Attendant). Shoe is definitely comfortable, outperforms any Ni*e pair I've used. Sole has held up after 5 straight months of daily use. The Gel technology works and absorbs the shock from heel to toe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Asics, but should have stuck with my Nimbus style.
customer_reviews.text: I actually needed to send my shoes back. I like the look and overall fit, but I found it just didn't have enough arch for me. I also felt what I can only describe a dots (glue dots?) along the inner side of the foot. I tried to go a little less expensive this year as I have had Asics Nimbus for about 4 years, but I feel because I am heavier (210#) and run like a Neanderthal, I just need more support and padding for the road training and triathlons I do. I think if you are a lighter and more technical of a runner, theses would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC TUCKER

customer_reviews.title: I used to wear Nike "Frees" but they gave me really bad foot pain in the morning
customer_reviews.text: I work in a an airport which requires constant standing and walking. I used to wear Nike "Frees" but they gave me really bad foot pain in the morning. Wearing these shoes up to 10hrs walking and standing I have no pain and its relatively comfortable. Also I had no "break in" pain. Amazing! I also use these to work out and run in, water and frost do easily get in because it has so much mesh to allow air, however they do dry quickly once you take them off at home.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased: More comfortable than expected. The wider fitting really helped. Use for daily walking and other outside activity when Spring and Summer arrive. I will probably order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: but I can say these are much more comfortable than any running shoes I've owned the past few ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an avid or experienced jogger. I run two to three times a week just to keep from getting too out of shape in my middle age. So I don't have any expertise in rating running shoes, but I can say these are much more comfortable than any running shoes I've owned the past few years. My knees and ankles have held up much better with these shoes than any others I've used. I've had recurring patellar tendinitis issues for almost a decade but it hasn't flared up since I've had these shoes. I don't know if that's a coincidence or not.
customer_reviews.author: Dumbluck

customer_reviews.title: Not for running
customer_reviews.text: I have used several pairs of the GT-1000 for a few years when I referee soccer games. It was always a good sneaker. This version (3) is cheap. The insole has no cushioning. The inside walls have very little cushioning. The sole is rigid, allowing insufficient bend. I was less than 50 yards into warming up when I strained my arch. I'm not even sure I can use this as a walking-around shoe. It should be a $30 shoe for people who aren't athletic. ASICS generally makes good running shoes, so this is disappointing. Hopefully, it's not a sign of company decline that they took a good shoe and made it bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Glad for the wider widths
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in these for a year, 10 to 20 miles a week, and have had no knee or ankle issues. I greatly appreciate that these come in wider widths (4E), which has allowed the sides of my toes to de-callous from previous shoes. I had some toenails turn black, but I have found that only happened when my socks had seams that ran across the top of the toes. I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: david w

customer_reviews.title: This is my first pair of Asics for running as I have been pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: So far these Asics have worked well as I needed a new pair of running shoes as I run 20-30 miles a week. The only issue I've had so far is blisters on the middle toe of both feet. These happened when I first starting running in these shoes so it might have just needed a break in period. Now they are working well with no blisters. This is my first pair of Asics for running as I have been pleased so far. I normally run in New Balance but wanted to try another brand and I know Asics has a history of making quality running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: One year in and these are still in great shape. Other brand shoes at a similar price point have been long since gone after a year of workouts multiple times per week as well as many long walks. I am hoping I get another good year out of them. Note - I have high arches and had to replace the insoles, no fault of the shoe. I used a Spenco product which works very well. Well worth the asking price!
customer_reviews.author: ZenguyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: nice Kayano alternative
customer_reviews.text: When on sale, I can find these for the half the price of Kayano's (which I LOVE!). I am a big guy (220 lbs) so I need support and cushion. The Kayano is still my "go to" running shoe. But for walking and general exercise, the GT-1000 shoe (for much cheaper) allows me great support and comfort while saving wear and tear on the Kayano's. The GT-1000 is a bit stiffer, which I think I actually prefer for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Levi

customer_reviews.title: These GT1000-3 Don't fit the same as the previous GT1000 versions
customer_reviews.text: It's a great shoe for most people but this GT1000-3 version has less room in the toe area than the previous version of the GT1000 and that caused me a problem even though they are each the same size & width. Be sure to try these on in a store before you buy them unless you already know your size will fit. Or if you want to gamble, go a half or full size larger.
customer_reviews.author: bsquare

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Great outdoor walking/running shoe for those of us with small & wide feet. Have looked for other shoes that fit wide enough but have always been disappointed; this one fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CMR

customer_reviews.title: Holding up ok after a year
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help get me back into running and it is holding up ok after almost a year of light running. I think shoes in general just aren't made to last like they used to. Will probably have to get it replaced here soon. Planned obsolescence maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Whaaaaat!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ok just gunna say these shoes are pretty awesome. There comfy as hell to run in. I run a butt load and these shoes helped my back and knees more then other shoes. I'm running on the clouds with these bad boys, and nothings holding me back. I don't know if there's any negative reviews about these shoes but if there is those guys ain't American, or just a fat obese one hahahahaha
customer_reviews.author: 1 DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for all day active wear
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits great! I have fallen arches and have to put in some arch supports when I wear them. I do this will every shoe I have owned. I really like the shoe and have actually bought style (this is the earlier model) for the last couple of times I have had to get new tennis shoes. I am on my feet all day (teaching PE and coaching football, wrestling and track). These shoes fit my active lifestyle!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Christensen

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are not cruel
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable pairs of shoes I've ever bought. I have a job that requires a lot of walking, and my feet are usually killing me by the time I get home. These shoes definitely help. They light weight, well padded, stylish, and affordable. So many athletic shoes have got these crazy neon designs - it's nice to find a straightforward but stylish sneaker that doesn't bust my wallet. Fit: As expected, with no toe pinching I'm buying an extra pair in case they stop making them - I want a backup pair!
customer_reviews.author: wordman

customer_reviews.title: Run Small so You Might Want to Go for a Wide Model
customer_reviews.text: My feet are 12 in some shoes (such as Timberlake chukkas Wide) and 13 in others. Asics run small, so I went with 13. The length was perfect for my first pair; however, they were too tight around the laces, so I returned and bought 4 Wide. Now they fit perfectly. The heel support feels good. The overall comfort is excellent. The look and fit and finish are more than acceptable for this price point. I am very happy I could find a good fit over the Internet, and I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: M. JEFFREY MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: I wear them for daily use and they are very comfortable. The issue is that they don't last long
customer_reviews.text: I have owned probably 10 pairs of asics over the past few years. As a guy with wide feet these are some of the only shoes I can find. I wear them for daily use and they are very comfortable. The issue is that they don't last long. Probably after 6 months these shoes are worn out and in need of replacement. To me that's become too annoying to stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Moss

customer_reviews.title: Good it and finish
customer_reviews.text: They have turned into my favorite shoes for walking and running. Very comfortable and so far durable.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Great X Country shoe
customer_reviews.text: HS CrossCountry running 3 hrs a day 5 days and week and meets on Saturdays (for warm up only) - He uses these shoe and puts a ton of miles on them. Buys new ones every few months - 500 miles then we replace. ASICS are great shoes, good support, traction, and same fit from shoe to shoe. Never have issues breaking new shoes in.
customer_reviews.author: Good Buy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. This is my second pair of ASICS
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. This is my second pair of ASICS. The first pair fit perfectly and felt great wearing them all day so I already knew what brand my next pair would be. I bought these slightly more expensive pair than my last pair cost because my feet deserve it. I don't run, but am on my feet all day running at work. I love the spring in my step feeling as I walk. These shoes fit perfectly in the exact size I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kendig

customer_reviews.title: Very well fitting and comfortable. I am a big guy 6'1" and about ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well fitting and comfortable. I am a big guy 6'1" and about 240 and tend toward over pronation and cannot wear shoes with a narrow toe box. I ordered one pair 12.5 4E to see how they fit and after two days of wearing them, I ordered a second pair. These are the most comfortable shoes that I have worn for a long time. They also seem to be solid and well made but I can't vouch for how well they will last yet. If they fall apart, I will let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a true fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2E or double wide. This just goes to show the inconsistency in the shoe industry. It fits somewhat tightly compared to other 2E running and casual shoes that are also 2E. I must say however the cushioning does feel pretty good when walking or running. Just have to see how long it stays that way, as it appears to be some sort of foam supports, which I'm thinking will get compressed over time
customer_reviews.author: CappiD

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got them, the area around the topmost lace eyelet (just next to the top of the tongue) was too stiff, and dug into my ankle a bit, but after wearing them about 6-10 times, they got broken in and proved really comfortable. I'm an overpronator and don't run, these are just my everyday shoes. I've been wearing Brooks Addiction since the 7th model, but I didn't like the Addiction 11 as much, so I wanted to try something new. Compared to the Brooks Addiction, these feel thinner under the ball, but overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: After 300 miles of use...
customer_reviews.text: These were the most comfortable pair of running shoes I've ever bought. After I started wearing them my lower back pain and hip pain subsided. They are extremely comfortable and provide great cushioning. I'm not crazy about the way they look on my feet, but that hardly concerns me as long as they don't cause any problems while running. They've also held up remarkably well. No fraying of the stitching whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: The Best Shoes I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastic. The best I've ever owned. I've bought many pairs over time. I would buy 20 at a time if I could afford to to keep in the closet because whenever I find a great shoe, it gets discontinued. I have very wide 4E feet and rheumatoid arthritis. Inherited tendency for bunions and on my feet for hours jogging at work. Lucky me right? I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: MelM

customer_reviews.title: A great spend.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Wore some very old Gel Koyanos when they we e good for support. As a fat footed, ankle rolling lumberer, I very much appreciate the support these shoes provide. Cushion is acceptable, definitely not cloudy, rather firm for a shoe with great support: the road feels immediate and responsive enough. An excellent bargain at just under 70.
customer_reviews.author: AlldoneAbe

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Product is as expected; size as requested, looks great, and feels even better! Outstanding service; fast and convenient!! A+++
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: These should feel absolutely amazing. I'm exercising regularly getting back in shape
customer_reviews.text: These should feel absolutely amazing. I'm exercising regularly getting back in shape, currently 6'1 and 250lbs. These shoes provide much better support and comfort than the Saucony's I was wearing, and they retain a nice light feel. Not as light as the Saucony, but the trade off is well worth it. I've walked 7 miles in these shoes each day this week and my feet feel great at the end of my walks.
customer_reviews.author: Nick from St. Louis

customer_reviews.title: I love my new shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: It is really hard to find my size 13, but I tried size 12.5 in this shoe and it fits comfortably. I was so happy because I wanted that model and that color. The GT is getting extinct now and hard to find in the right size and right color. I love my new shoes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Elgendy

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I ordered a 10.5 wide on a 1000 4 model. It was a little short. My old Asics was 10.5 regular width and there were ample room up front. I returned it and had to get the 1000 3 for the 11 wide. This one fits well and feels comfy. You need the get a full size larger than your normal shoe size to have a fit.
customer_reviews.author: Wagner

customer_reviews.title: I weight 310 pounds
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my feet all day I work for the postal service and in the afternoons I go to a warehouse where I'm on a concrete floor for 7 hrs and I get on average 5 months out of these shoes they fit as I expected as the first pair I ordered did, so the order I'm about to make will be order number three of these shoes
customer_reviews.author: cam

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My son has issues with his feet and requires a quality shoe. This is more than I wanted to pay for an kids shoe, but it has been good for him and it has held up very well, even with daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Turningleaf

customer_reviews.title: Tight across the top for a 4E
customer_reviews.text: For a 4E shoe, this didn't seem like one. I wear a 10.5 4E, usually. However, this shoe was way too tight across the top of the shoe. The toebox could have used a little more room. I have a few other 10.5 4E shoes and they fit fine. I guess some shoes won't fit the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 15 year old son. Keep in mind, Asics size run small. My son is usually 11.5 with Nike. I got Asics in size 12.5 and it fits him perfectly. He said it's very comfortable. Amazon has the best price. Came in quickly all the way to Hawaii. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: M. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: I love the bang for your buck of the GT-1000 series
customer_reviews.text: I love the bang for your buck of the GT-1000 series. The 3's are a little more cushioned in the toe than the 2's were. I'm a pretty neutral runner (just VERY slight under) and these are great for 5k training. I'm still using my 2's at the gym. They held up great, but I retire all my kicks at the same mileage. These have the same build quality and are just as comfortable as their predecessors.
customer_reviews.author: FreeCoffee

customer_reviews.title: mild over-pronating dude who is a sad new inductee to the world of Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 16, 220 lb, mild over-pronating dude who is a sad new inductee to the world of Plantar Fasciitis, but these shoes give all the support and cushioning I need. I now wear them to work even when they don't go with my outfit because "Oh, Comfort!" Like all well-styled shoes of this size, they do not magnify the hugeness of my feet. I will never buy a pair of Brooks again when these are obviously comparable construction, better materials and nearly half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: KaeSue

customer_reviews.title: Let the air in
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, lightweight, cool mesh shoes. If you have normal arches, they should provide decent arch support. I need orthotics for any shoe I've ever owned. Seem to be well made and hopefully will hold up well. Nice stabile platform for such a lightweight shoe. Price was right as well. One nice feature is that the gel doesn't seem to be in the insole, so when I replaced it with my orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: WaltR TechnomageTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... I knew what size to order and these fit fine. Wish I could figure out what the difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Asics before so I knew what size to order and these fit fine. Wish I could figure out what the difference is (besides price) for the dozens of differnet Asics models that all seem the same. Maybe to workd class runners it'd make a difference but to a guy that just wants a comfortable pair of walking shoes with decent support these are fine and I wear them daily when I need to wear shoes (usually go barefoot if I can). Lightweight, breathable, good fit. When these wear out I'll order another pair of Asics.
customer_reviews.author: G. Breen

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, good support, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My feet are fairly flat and these provided just the right amount of support without the use of an insert. I had looked at the GT-2000 at a local store but they were a bit too cushy for my taste. Shipment came in on a Monday, broke them in during the week for about 10 miles, and ran the Peachtree 10K in the rain that Saturday. Lightweight and felt fine even when soaked. Very pleased with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes. Fit just right on my feet.I think I put more than 200 miles on them running on hard surfaces. Looks like they still have good tread left, another 100 miles maybe.
customer_reviews.author: go chujang

customer_reviews.title: Much more narrow than New Balance of the same size.
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes, Great Price, but I went to the New Balance store and had my feet measured to make sure I would buy the correct size. Turns out I am an 11.5 2e, and the new balance shoes in that size fit me perfect. But this pair of basics, 11.5 2e is a lot more narrow than the new balance 11.5 2e. I will keep them because they were $55. compared to $125 for new balance.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas J. Leskowak

customer_reviews.title: and i still wear em after the trip they still feel great. the ygot kinda worn out after the climbing ...
customer_reviews.text: i needed shoes that i could walk all day in since I was going on a trip to japan. these shoes lasted the whole time without making my feet feel uncomfortable and we did alot of walking basically from the bottom of japan to the middle and i even climbed mt fuji in the same shoes, and i still wear em after the trip they still feel great. the ygot kinda worn out after the climbing the mountain cuz of the terrain but id recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kouta S.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: Asics keeps putting out the same basic shoe under varying model names. Wear them every day. Great cushioning. On some the toes wear thru on other the counters crack. on average they last 9mo to a year. Hope Asics never radically changes these useful shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J Milton

customer_reviews.title: Jarring lack of shock absorbsion
customer_reviews.text: Although listed as using a gel technology sole, I found this shoe to provide very little in the way of cushioning. Each footfall transmits jarring road shock straight to the ankles and knees. I bought the GT-100 3 because of the excellent shock absorption provided by other Asics running shoes. Sizing is a little off(smaller/narrower) but not a major issue for me. I can not recommend the GT-1000 3 nor would I purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Support I needed
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and going to asics website to detrimen what shoes I need for my plantar fasciitis issue. I ending get these shoes. Boy! I'm glad I did. It provided the stability support that I need. The cushion in heel and ball area are a big upside. I used them in gym for over a month now. Very impressed that I don't need to buy a insole support anymore. I hope you have a good experience with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Gman68

customer_reviews.title: Flat foot some running, more walking
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a firm shoe. I got it. My trail shoes are a little more breathable and light but for running or walking on the road I was Looking for support and comfort. I had shin splints before and can tell the difference after running or waking; I don't feel the extreme tension in my legs. Great shoes for a flat footed.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: First time online
customer_reviews.text: We have never bought shoes online before so this was a good start. My husband has a wide foot and it's hard to find them in the stores also. Since he has worn this same brand before we thought we would try it. We got the same size he has had in the past and the pricing was better then at the stores. So far so good. He has been wearing them a week now and all is well. Will definitely buy his shoes this way in the future.
customer_reviews.author: April McClellan

customer_reviews.title: Good solid training shoe for most fun and fitness runners
customer_reviews.text: I've worn ASICS for years and usually this design. I've worn the 2000 series and yes, the more expensive ones are marginally cushier, but value-wise, these make more sense. Good solid training shoe for most fun and fitness runners. For high-level runners, heavy people, or racing, no at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. Karkut

customer_reviews.title: They are NOT waterproof! Not even close.
customer_reviews.text: They are NOT waterproof! Gore-tex means waterproof but these shoes are NOT waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: cenk

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe for Chefs!!!
customer_reviews.text: 14 EEE!! These shoes are very comfortable from the very first day I put them on. They are very lightweight and are super comfortable. They have great support for your arches and they breath very well. I work as a chef and stand all day for about 10-12 hrs a shift. These are totally great for running, working or just for yard work. I will definitely purchase these shoes again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Glen Edward Davis

customer_reviews.title: This is a good walk around shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good walk around shoe. It's hard to find nice sneakers in the black on black format. Add some gorilla tape to the insde of the shoe to help prevent holes from forming in the toe box area.
customer_reviews.author: John Behring

customer_reviews.title: Super light. Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Somewhat subdued look, but still looks sharp. Super light. Super comfortable. Mesh uppers provide excellent ventilation. Cons: Glossy material used on graphics is a bit too flashy. (Con for me. Not necessarily a con for others.) Mesh uppers ventilate too well. Not the best for cold weather use.
customer_reviews.author: RKO

customer_reviews.title: I simply love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My first time buying shoes online. I tried out the same shoe in a different color in a local shoe store to be sure they fit me properly before I purchased them online. I simply love these shoes, they quickly became my favorite pair. They're so breathable, the porous mesh material allows cool air to flow up against my toes when I walk quickly or jog. Hopefully these shoes will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ehab

customer_reviews.title: Dry conditions only
customer_reviews.text: This is listed under the heading of "waterproof" and it is NOT. Short, mowed lawn with a heavy dew (no puddles or rain) and with me walking caused saturation of this shoe. The tongue is loose and not waterproof so the shoes collect water.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: great choice of colors and very durable. it is my 5th pair
customer_reviews.text: an addendum it runs a half size larger, not smaller as I had it earlier. the hindfoot / forefoot ration is too small and requires extra hindfoot cushion. however it's my second pair. i suggest spenco insole which provides missing support. the pair is pretty deep and could receive extra insole.
customer_reviews.author: David Yakub

customer_reviews.title: Better but still not quite what they were a few years ago.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I do like the fit though i could have probably gone with a more narrow shoe. They are still not quite as comfortable as the 2150 and 2170's that i have had in the past (thus the 4 star instead of 5 star rating), but much better than the other recent ones i have owned. Sure to miss my 2150's -- by far the BEST shoe i have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Glen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Active Work Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to wear for a bartending position at a resort which requires me to be on my feet all day whilst occasionally having to briskly run for quick supply grabs and these have worked better than I ever could have hoped – I haven't even needed to buy cushioning inserts! If you're looking at a job position which requires "minimal black-on-black footwear", then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainNoBeard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this shoe. SO COMFORTABLE.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this shoe. SO COMFORTABLE. I can never seem to find them in all black at the shoe stores. Thank God for Amazon Prime! Paid an extra $4.99 had the delivered the next day. I wear them all day. Great support. I have flat feet and planters facilities and these help A LOT!!!
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable, returned
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable at all. I have another pair of Asics and think they are OK, but I definitely think Nike's are more comfortable and lighter weight. I think the sizing is fine, seems to fit as expected, but I just don't find them comfortable. I returned these.
customer_reviews.author: Gusto Blue

customer_reviews.title: Asic GT1000-3
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried the first run I took with them. Felt a little inflexible and left heel hurt some. But each subsequent run has felt much better. I guess they needed a break in period. The stability has been great as I have a pronation problem which these shoes handle quite well. The toe box fit is fine, the arch and heel fit are very good. I find the fit after the toe box to the midfoot a little narrow. Hopefully it will loosen up a bit as they are broken in a little more. Cushioing feels good. As of now I am satisfied with these Asic's and hope they feel better with age.........
customer_reviews.author: Marc B.

customer_reviews.title: Navy Blue Asics Work with Everything
customer_reviews.text: These are great running shoes, though I mostly wear them for walking. I've been a fan of the Asics GT-2160 for several years, when I did lots of running. Now that I need less shock absorption, I've been able to open up to more styles within the Asics brand. In addition to being comfortable for all day wear, these are very good looking and versatile (work with athletic wear, jeans and cargo pants) because they are dark. I get compliments on these all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Siegrid Thorsted

customer_reviews.title: They are WONDERFUL! He's on his feet all day and his ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband was wearing New Balance but the quality went downhill. We went to Sports Authority and got him a pair of these. They are WONDERFUL! He's on his feet all day and his feet don't hurt. This is the second pair. We;ll be buying them from Amazon, as the price is much better than what we paid at Sports Authority.
customer_reviews.author: lildeb56

customer_reviews.title: Too small and narrow and rubbing stitching inside by big toe.
customer_reviews.text: The stitching inside the shoe by the big toe was protruding out and kept rubbing against my toe and I even bought the wide width and a 1/2 size bigger and still were too small and too narrow. Horrible. Not the ASICS I was used to years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gardner

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shoe for the cost its put at
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe for the cost its put at. Very durable and comfortable, I am actually using it for outdoor sport and I am very happy I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chitramanalan

customer_reviews.title: He and I only wear keens and asics in order to keep our feet happy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my hubby. He has very wide flat feet. this is his 4th pair. I buy him a new pair every year and he uses his old pair to work in the yard. He is not a runner but wears them for everyday outside activity and loves them. He and I only wear keens and asics in order to keep our feet happy.
customer_reviews.author: CRB

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoes
customer_reviews.text: One of the best fitting shoes out there. The only problem is that it's very easy to rub a hole in the mesh above the big toe. After that happens all you can do is throw away the pair. But typically you should get a good year out of them before that happens. At least that's been my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Misfit

customer_reviews.title: It's clear why this is such a popular model.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, supportive, comfortable shoes. Popular model at a great price. I've been running around 15 miles a week for the past 6 months in these, and they are still in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: tomp

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for an unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: As I've come to expect from the ASICS brand. The shoes for the prices cannot be beat! I still have my original ASICS gel contend three shoes after year and after 120 miles ran in the shoes and they still look as good as when I purchase them. Will continue to keep buying this brand until they stop making them.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love how they fit, the stable cushion and the light feel to them. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Great Footware for those on their feet all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I found these running shoes to be very durable. I use them for work and these are actually a replacement pair of the exact same shoe I've worn for a couple years. My massage therapist said I should change shows every 8 months thus I immediately looked for another pair! Good shoes are very important when your on your feet as much as I am! It's also hard to find good sneakers in all black, a requirement at work!
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT L HENDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Returning - fit is very different from GT-2000 3 -- uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am returning these GT-1000 3 shoes. I have a pair of GT-2000 3 shoes with 700+ miles on them, and I wanted an all-black pair, but that's not available in 2000s. GT-1000 3 in black, cheaper, great -- but I was surprised to find the 1000s just don't fit the same. Something about the footbed was just different and very wrong for me. They made my feet feel "hot" and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Normally I use number 8. I bought 8 is ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally I use number 8. I bought 8 is big I retorted to Amazon I bought it’s numbers 7.5 is big too. I can’t use this is big.
customer_reviews.author: Reginaldo

customer_reviews.title: I have always worn New Balance and enjoyed them. Thought I would try a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding shoes. I have always worn New Balance and enjoyed them. Thought I would try a different brand. Thoroughly impressed by the fit and comfort. Only had them a few weeks so will need to see if they are as hardy as NB. So far very pleased
customer_reviews.author: thekrf

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. I'm a basketball official and this shoe is good for my feet. I did purchase seperate orthopedic insoles due to the all the running I do.
customer_reviews.author: scf1278

customer_reviews.title: Great cross training shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I have put so many miles on these shoes running, doing cardio intervals and tons of other things. These shoes are so comfy I will never wear another pair of nikes again.
customer_reviews.author: caleb thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are light and comfortable. I wish they had a better arch support, but they are good when I put my orthotic in.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Book Daily

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love them I'm not a runner but I'm on my feet on concrete all day these shoes are the best
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as the older models
customer_reviews.text: Something different about these ASICS. Not as comfortable as my Cumulus 15s. They were fine but I ended up returning them. Maybe something about my feet has changed but I had a much harder time finding a comfortable ASICS shoe. Ended up with the GT 1000 4s which are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Psi 5

customer_reviews.title: Predictably Good
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet for my size (6'2", size 12 shoe). It can make buying running shoes challenging. I have found ASICS to be a good fit that doesn't require a whole lot of trying shoes on and shopping around. This shoe fits well and has good support.
customer_reviews.author: G. MCDONALDTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I had surgery on my ankle and my podiatrist recommended switching to a running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Asics running shoe as I'm a Basketball Official. I previously was wearing a shoe that was designed for running and jumping on a basketball court. I had surgery on my ankle and my podiatrist recommended switching to a running shoe. The Asics GT-1000 3 Running shoe was a great fit. I can't believe how light this shoe feels. I seem to have gained more speed as a result of this shoe's construction.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for over-pronaters
customer_reviews.text: This is my shoe now. Very good for my inner-shin splints (supplemented of course with proper exercise, stretching, and weight control), but these things are like running on a cloud without losing much speed, if any. Remember, always order a half size or full size up from your lounging shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, cushy ride for walking or jogging. Decent arch support. If you like a lot of arch support, go up to the 2000 or 3000. This shoe does have a lot of friction when sliding your foot in - little hard to get in to in a hurry in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes can't wear them
customer_reviews.text: they are not wide enough at the end where it counts. I can't wear the shoes at all. I took them into a shoe store and naturally the person didn't listen to me as to where they needed widen so he make them wider at the instep instead of at the end. It was a waste buying and trying to fix. I'm not sure what I'm going to do.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately there is free shipping and return option
customer_reviews.text: Narrower than they should be. I have had to buy different widths and return as I try them until I find the right one. I will lastly order size 4E and if that size doesn't fit well, then I forget Asics and go for a different brand. Fortunately there is free shipping and return option.
customer_reviews.author: JFP

customer_reviews.title: Best workout shoes I've owned. Easy on the knees, ankles, and feet.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ASICS as my workout shoe since Sophomore year of highschool. I had had tendentious in my knees prior to switching to ASICS and within a month the pain was gone. Used ASICS as my workoutshoes ever since, through highschool and college football. Will never buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Tanner

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: My second pair ... First pair is three years old
customer_reviews.author: lynn standafer

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit - Should be a comfortable and Yet Supportive Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Feels firm enough for running (which I'll do in the coming week), but I wore them on a DC to Kingston, Jamaica flight, with quite a bit of walking involved, and they were comfortable all the way. The narrowness for me was at the midsole. All else fit snugly, not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: RyanP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe, really comfortable. However, after about a year or so of constant wear the insole will kind of wear out and sort of mush down, providing less arch support. Other than that, the shoe has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: These Asics are great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like Asics and I prefer the running shoes over cross trainers. I got these and they were comfortable right out of the box. No break-in period needed! I've been wearing these everyday since I got them, about a week ago and they feel very good and the colors are really nice too! Highly recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoDave

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Gt-1000 3 Black/Onyx/Lightning Ankle-High Running Shoe - 7WW
product_meta.description: The third version of the GT-1000 elevates the series to a new echelon of technical performance, now proudly designed with Impact Guidance System (I.G.S). The bouncy SpEVA Midsole has been reengineered to be more protective and cushioned, while the DuoMax Support System and Guidance Trusstic provide excellent support for mild to moderate overpronators. In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
